content.description: Extremely low start inside the cave with a solid left hand and small, slopey right hand. Traverse right across the whole bottom of the boulder until you reach the good edge at the far end, then there's a big move to the top of the formation before topping out.
content.location: At the very bottom of the hill, near the water tank.

content.description: Start low with a left hand side pull and right hand on the sharp crimp on the underside of the boulder. I topout to the left, using a knee bar to reach the upper pinch.
content.location: Located on the tallest, and easiest to spot, boulder on the hill. Directly uphill from One Your God Chose.

content.description: Start far to the left, traversing right. Avoid dabbing on the protruding rock about halfway through, then top out to the right after the big deadpoint.
Start matched down low and shoot out right. Crux is the first few moves, the upper part is juggy but very fun (with a rocky landing).
content.location: Start with both hands on the lowest undercling, nearby the starting holds of Popping Out of Nothing, but going out right instead of left.

content.description: Start bunched up with both hands on the slopey lip to the far right of the boulder, and traverse leftward. Very fun problem with interesting beta options.
content.location: Fairly large outcropping close to the top of the hill. Up and right when facing Popping Out Of Nothing.

content.description: Start on the underside with both hands on a well chalked jug. Slap out right to the ticked hold, and the continue up the right side of the boulder. The crux for me is the top out.
content.location: Bulbous looking boulder slightly downhill from My Heart.

content.description: Utilizing the same jug start as "Moncler Coat," this problem slaps out left for a few very slopey moves. Not sure of difficulty since I haven't been able to do it.
content.location: Same bulbous looking boulder as Moncler Coat, slightly downhill from My Heart.

content.description: Start is the crux, feet are very important. First move is up to pinch, then  up to sloped ledge, up to bread loaf, crappy crimp then up to obvious two finger "pocket" surrounded by moss and traverse on side of boulder up to the very top. DO NOT use rocks beside the boulder or obvious large ledge on boulder for your feet.
content.location: On the same boulder as Popping Out of Nothing. Cave has lots of potential. Start is left hand crimp and right hand on awkward sloped ledge. On the biggest boulder found here at Eversince. If cleaned up, could definitely be more problems on this boulder.
Small chossy outcropping next to My Heart.

content.description: Start bunched up at the very left end. This problem is just a lip traverse, ending on the right side of the boulder.
content.location: Slightly uphill from Rose Bud, adjacent to Montcler Coat.

content.description: Left hand starts on a small crimp, with the right hand on a far out pinch. Top out to the left, which is only 4-5 moves depending on beta.
content.location: Smaller boulder at the bottom of the hill, to the left when facing Rose Bud.

content.description: Group of 8 close-together boulders on a steep hillside just inside Rothrock State Forest (15 minute drive from State College).
